Title: Human Trust and Digital Twins in a Human Factors and Ergonomic Framework
Authors: L. Pietrantoni, Mabel San Román-Niaves, M. Angelis
Venue: IEEE International Conference on Emerging Technologies and Factory Automation
Abstract summary: The paper discusses the importance of integrating human factors and ergonomics principles to enhance the accuracy and functionality of digital twins, fostering trust and collaboration.

Title: A comprehensive review of the dynamic applications of the digital twin technology across diverse energy sectors
Authors: Firas Basim Ismail, Hussein Al-Faiz, H. Hasini, Ammar F. J. Al-Bazi, Hussein A. Kazem

Title: Energy Digital Twin applications: A review
Authors: João Victor Soares do Amaral, C.H. dos Santos, J. Montevechi, A.R. de Queiroz

Title: Digital twin in battery energy storage systems: Trends and gaps detection through association rule mining
Authors: C. Semeraro, H. Aljaghoub, M. Abdelkareem, A. Alami, A. Olabi
Abstract summary: This paper does not address the impact of digital twins on human operator performance and trust in the energy sector, but rather focuses on the trends and gaps in the use of digital twins for battery energy storage systems.

Title: XR and digital twins, and their role in human factor studies
Abstract summary: The paper discusses how combining XR technology with digital twins can optimize the design and operations of nuclear systems, including assessing human performance.

Title: Human-Agent Trust Evaluation in a Digital Twin Context
Authors: D. Doroftei, Tom De Vleeschauwer, S. Bue, Michaël Dewyn, Frik Vanderstraeten, G. D. Cubber
Venue: IEEE International Symposium on Robot and Human Interactive Communication

Title: A Theoretical Open Architecture Framework and Technology Stack for Digital Twins in Energy Sector Applications
Authors: S. Gourisetti, S. Bhadra, D. Sebastian-Cardenas, Md Touhiduzzaman, Osman Ahmed

Title: Recent trends of digital twin technologies in the energy sector: A comprehensive review
Authors: C. Ghenai, Lama Al Haj Husein, Marwa Al Nahlawi, A. Hamid, M. Bettayeb
